text:
David Goldblatt (29 November 1930 – 25 June 2018) was a South African photographer. He was known for his photographs of South Africa during the period of apartheid and more recently that country's landscapes. He called himself as a “self-appointed observer" and "critic of the society into which I was born.”
Goldblatt died on 25 June 2018 in Johannesburg from skin cancer, aged 87.
